thread.title: Shropshire school children get to keep bikes they make in school
thread.title_full: Shropshire school children get to keep bikes they make in school

title: Shropshire school children get to keep bikes they make in school
text:
Media playback is unsupported on your device Shropshire school children get to keep bikes they make in school 21 February 2017 Last updated at 14:39 GMT 
School pupils studying GCSE Design and Technology are using computers and learning hands-on skills to build bikes which they get to keep. 
The idea is the brainchild of Andrew Jones, head of design and technology at Adams' Grammar School in Newport, Shropshire.
